Key Arguments: The bill restricts freedom of speech on the internet in Australia.
Definitions for misinformation and disinformation are inadequate.
The bill does not clearly define 'harm'.
ACMA is set up as an arbiter of truth, which is problematic.
The bill forces digital platforms to censor users, leading to self-censorship.
ACMA has too much power and can reject industry codes.
The bill gives ACMA quasi-judicial powers without proper legal protections.
Certain parties are exempt from the bill's requirements, which is unfair.
Notable Quotes: In a free and democratic country like Australia, every person has the right to form their own opinion about an issue.
The government seeks to use this bill to prevent free speech in Australia.
It will severely restrict freedom of speech on the internet in Australia.
The bill sets up ACMA as an arbiter of truth for content on digital platform services.
